pullRequest.body:
We introduce antidiagonals for scalar multiplication and vector addition, and show that they are finite for partially well-ordered input sets.  We also add some results involving minima.  This will be used in future PRs on Hahn modules and vertex operators.

- [x] depends on: #14732 

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [b29c18d928](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14479/commits/b29c18d928731ab0328fdded64be855c5be7ce75)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.Set.SMulAntidiagonal`|520|
| `Mathlib.Data.Finset.SMulAntidiagonal`|571|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsOrderedSMul.smul_le_smul`
`+ IsPWO.smul`
`+ IsWF.min_smul`
`+ IsWF.smul`
`+ Monotone.smul`
`+ SMulAntidiagonal`
`+ SMulAntidiagonal_min_smul_min`
`+ eq_of_fst_eq_fst`
`+ eq_of_fst_le_fst_of_snd_le_snd`
`+ eq_of_snd_eq_snd`
`+ finite_of_isPWO`
`+ fst_eq_fst_iff_snd_eq_snd`
`+ isPWO_support_smulAntidiagonal`
`+ smulAntidiagonal`
`+ support_smulAntidiagonal_subset_smul`
`++ mem_smulAntidiagonal`
`++ smulAntidiagonal_mono_left`
`++ smulAntidiagonal_mono_right`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

:v: ScottCarnahan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the reviews!
bors r+

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10032155238/job/27723450861)
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10032233596/job/27723628393)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10032233596/job/27723628468)

It is the naming. `IsWF.SMul` now exists in the same namespace as `IsWF.min_SMul`. 

If the naming was kept as is, convention would be `IsWF.smul` but I think `Set.isWF_smul` is better. Also, for similar declarations here.
I tried `Set.isWF_smul` but then the dot notation proofs got more cumbersome.  It looks like `IsWF.smul` is consistent with the naming in the corresponding `MulAntidiagonal` files.
Also, thanks for letting me know about the interaction between typeclasses and theorem names. I totally did not expect that.
Wrong doc string?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (Algebra/Order/AddTorsor) : Antidiagonals for SMul and VAdd, with finiteness properties
